item.title: Five Zero-Days, 15 Misconfigurations Found in Salesforce Industry Cloud
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Security researchers uncover critical flaws and widespread misconfigurations in Salesforce’s industry-specific CRM solutions.

The post Five Zero-Days, 15 Misconfigurations Found in Salesforce Industry Cloud appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Critical Vulnerability Patched in SAP NetWeaver
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
SAP has fixed a critical NetWeaver vulnerability allowing attackers to bypass authorization checks and escalate their privileges.

The post Critical Vulnerability Patched in SAP NetWeaver appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Sensitive Information Stolen in Sensata Ransomware Attack
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Sensor manufacturer Sensata said a ransomware group had access to its network for more than a week and stole personal information.

The post Sensitive Information Stolen in Sensata Ransomware Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Exploited Vulnerability Impacts Over 80,000 Roundcube Servers
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Exploitation of a critical-severity RCE vulnerability in Roundcube started only days after a patch was released.

The post Exploited Vulnerability Impacts Over 80,000 Roundcube Servers appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Vulnerabilities Exposed Phone Number of Any Google User
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Google has awarded $5,000 to a researcher who found security holes that enabled brute-forcing the phone number of any user. 

The post Vulnerabilities Exposed Phone Number of Any Google User appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Whole Foods Distributor United Natural Foods Hit by Cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
United Natural Foods has taken some systems offline after detecting unauthorized activity on its IT systems, causing disruptions to operations.

The post Whole Foods Distributor United Natural Foods Hit by Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Chinese Hackers and User Lapses Turn Smartphones Into a ‘Mobile Security Crisis’
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Foreign hackers have increasingly identified smartphones, other mobile devices and the apps they use as a weak link in U.S. cyberdefenses.

The post Chinese Hackers and User Lapses Turn Smartphones Into a ‘Mobile Security Crisis’ appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Chinese Espionage Crews Circle SentinelOne in Year-Long Reconnaissance Campaign
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Anti-malware vendor said it spent the past twelve months deflecting a stream of network reconnaissance probes from China-nexus threat actors

The post Chinese Espionage Crews Circle SentinelOne in Year-Long Reconnaissance Campaign appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Guardz Banks $56M Series B for All-in-One SMB Security
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
The Israeli company said the Series B raise was led by ClearSky and included equity stakes for new backer Phoenix Financial.

The post Guardz Banks $56M Series B for All-in-One SMB Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Mirai Botnets Exploiting Wazuh Security Platform Vulnerability
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
CVE-2025-24016, a critical remote code execution vulnerability affecting Wazuh servers, has been exploited by Mirai botnets.

The post Mirai Botnets Exploiting Wazuh Security Platform Vulnerability  appeared first on SecurityWeek.
